body.p: It is useful to think about the immune system in terms of those aspects with which we are born and those that we acquire later referred to as acquired or adaptive immunity. Which of the processes below do not fit into the category of innate immunity?

multiple_choice.choice: Mechanical and chemical barriers such as sticky mucus membranes and your tears
Manufacturing antibodies as the result of getting a vaccination
Phagocytosis of foreign invaders by macrophates or other cells
Destruction of an invading organism by the complement system

feedback.p: Incorrect. This function is a part of the innate immune system.
Correct. Making antibodies also known as immunoglobulins are part of the adaptive immune reponse.
Phagocytosis by macrophages, neutrophils and other cells are part of the innate immune system.
Incorrect.The complement system is part of the innate immune response.
